intro: Chrysopsis imbricata, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Chrysopsis imbricata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
